meaningMnemonic: A <kanji>beautiful</kanji> <kanji>person</kanji> is a <vocabulary>beautiful woman</vocabulary>. Wait, why isn't this a beautiful person? In fact, this word used to have a broader meaning, but for some reason it's generally only used for women in modern Japanese.
readingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since 人 has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

Where you're from, every <vocabulary>beautiful woman</vocabulary> wears <reading>bee</reading> <reading>jean</reading>s (びじん). That's right, jeans made out of bees. Beauty knows no pain after all!
